document.docAuthor: Schmidt, C. A. & Shattuck, S. O.
document.masterDocTitle: The Higher Classification of the Ant Subfamily Ponerinae (Hymenoptera: Formicidae), with a Review of Ponerine Ecology and Behavior

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Higher Classification of the Ant Subfamily Ponerinae (Hymenoptera: Formicidae), with a Review of Ponerine Ecology and Behavior

subSubSection.paragraph:
Brown (1975) provides a key to
Platythyrea species
that is only slightly outdated due to the subsequent description of two additional species, while De Andrade (2004) provides a key to New World
Platythyrea ,
including both extant and fossil species. In the species list below (and throughout this publication) only the country of the type localities is given.

P. strenua Wheeler, W.M. & Mann, 1914
: Haiti

†
P. dlusskyi Aria
, et al. 2011: Oise Amber

†
P. primaeva Wheeler, W.M., 1915
: Baltic Amber

†
P. pumilio De Andrade, 2004
: Dominican Amber
